alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central El Paso County; Northern Hudspeth Highlands, Hueco Mountains; Western El Paso County (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 6:41PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Otero, southeastern Dona Ana, northwestern Hudspeth and northeastern El Paso Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 541 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Northeast El Paso to Hueco Tanks. Movement was east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northeast El Paso, Chaparral, Hueco Tanks, Hueco Mountain Estates, Butterfield, Homestead Meadows, and Franklin Mountains State Park. This includes Highway 54 in New Mexico near mile marker 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern, Central El Paso County; Northern Hudspeth Highlands, Hueco Mountains; Western El Paso County
